message_1: What is the type-theoretic definition of the natural number 3?
message_2:
In type theory, natural numbers are defined using the Peano axioms. The natural number 3 can be defined using the successor function S, which takes a natural number and returns the next natural number. The type-theoretic definition of the natural number 3 is:

3 = S(S(S(0)))

This means that 3 is the successor of the successor of the successor of 0.
